IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Educating students within a four-year, non-profit liberal arts college program.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Central Christian College of Kansas (1884), an evangelical Christian College embracing the Wesleyan Tradition, provides a personalized educational experience through liberal arts and professional studies that seeks to prepare students to be academically competent, socially responsible, professionally astute, service oriented, and spiritually mature in their faith in Jesus Christ.
IRS990.Description: Instruction & Academic Support Central Christian College is a four-year, liberal arts college providing higher education opportunities leading to one of three degrees in 23 major areas. Instruction and library services are provided for 328 full-time and 138 part-time students. Classes are taught by 19 full-time instructors and 20 who are part-time. Nearly 95% of the students attending Central Christian College receive some type of scholarship.

Activity2.Description: Auxiliary Enterprises Central Christian College is a residential campus and operates four dormitories and a food service facility. These housing and food services are provided to 278 students, approximately 85% of the full-time enrollment. A snack bar, coffee shop and some recreational facilities are available to students.

Activity3.Description: Student Services The Student Services arm of Central Christian College actively provides services to all students in the areas of academic advising, career guidance, counseling, residence life, student government and intercollegiate athletics. The administration of the Financial Aid Office is an important function under Student Services. The Admissions Office also operates within this program to ensure a steady enrollment of new students at the college.

ActivityOther.Description: Institutional Support. Institutional support for Central Christian College is provided by the various administrative offices including President, Business Office, Development Office and the College Relations Office. In addition to providing the general administration of the institution these support offices are also instrumental in raising the additional contributed funds that are necessary for continued existence of the College.

InvestmentsProgramRelated.Description: Assets Held in Trust by Others

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The purpose of the Central Christian College Endowment Fund is to generate income to fund the scholarships being awarded each semester and to support the annual operations of the institution.
Scholarships and grants 2,459,507 + Endowment gifts 82,580 + Gain on perpetual trusts 37,762 + Change in value of split interest agreements (3589) = 2,576,260.
Scholarships and grants 2,459,507 minus SEOG award 62,085 = 2,397,422.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: The College publishes this policy through the college catalog, both in hard copy and on-line, on the application for admission, both in hard copy and on-line, and on the financial aid award letter.
IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: Central Christian College participates in all of the eligible federal student assistance programs offered by the U.S. Department of Education to the institution and to the students individually.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: All grants and awards made by Central Christian College are administered by the Financial Aid Office under the guidelines and regulations established by the U.S. Department of Education. All such grants, awards and scholarships appear on the individual award letters that are signed by the student recipients. These same grants and awards can be traced directly to each student's account and on through the college's accounting system.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Two members of the Board of Trustees are brothers.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A copy of the Form 990 is provided to members of the College's audit (finance) committee with an opportunity to comment or ask questions prior to filing the return.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The conflict of interest policy and related forms are distributed annually to the Board of Trustees. Trustees are expected to complete the disclosure forms each year.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Board of Trustees established the salary of the President of the College. The Board took into account the following factors: a. the salary of the previous president, b. the qualifications and experience of the president-elect, c. special circumstances regarding strategic plans for the college and d. salaries of presidents at comparable colleges. The President sets the salaries of key employees by taking into account the following: a. employee's position, b. experience, c. academic credentials, d. longevity and e. current budget. The President will inform the Board of Trustees of his decisions and the factors used in setting salaries. This process was just utilized in hiring the current president who took office in January 2010.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The College makes its governing documents, conflict of interest policy and financial statements available to the public upon written request.

The Audit Committee of the Board of Trustees oversees the college audit process and is directly involved in the selection of the independent accountant. The process has not changed over the past year.

ReasonableCauseExplanation.Explanation: Form 8868 was filed and an extension granted.
